en.av_c1: Here is a graphical depiction for a linked list storing five integers. The value stored in a pointer variable is indicated by an arrow "pointing" to something. A NULL pointer is indicated graphically by a diagonal slash through a pointer variable's box. The vertical line between the nodes labeled 23 and 10 indicates the current position (immediately to the right of this line).
en.av_c2: The list's first node is accessed from a pointer named head. To speed access to the end of the list, and to allow the append method to be performed in constant time, tail points to the last node of the list. The position of the current element is indicated by curr.
en.av_c3: Here is what we would like to have happen when we delete the current node (the one with value 10).
